name: lithium iron phosphate production, hydrothermal process | lithium iron phosphate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26727/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg lithium iron phosphate (LFP) via hydrothermal process, used as active material in the production of LFP cathodes in Li-ion batteries. 

The activity starts when the chemicals enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production at factory gate of LFP active material via hydrothermal process.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2014 (year of the publication of data) and 2025 (assuming that this producing technology is still viable in the near future)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is extrapolated from CN production to global.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: ;Lithium iron phosphate can be produced via hydrothermal process or solid state process. The hydrothermal process requires the use of reactants such as lithium hydroxide, phosphoric acid and iron sulfate, and heating of water in addition to the reactants. ;;The general reaction is the following: ;3LiOH(aq) + H3PO4(aq) + FeSO4(aq) --> LiFePO4(s) + Li2SO4(aq) + 3H2O;Reference: ;;Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset was extrapolated from national producers to global.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The data about the production process of LFP are retrieved from the literature (Dunn et al., 2014). 

Reference: 
Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value 31.421 mmBTU/ton LFP taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National LAboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dunn et al. (2014). Conversion factors: 1 mmBTU = 1,055.055853 MJ 

Reference:
Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on Annual production: 27000 metric ton cathode material (Dai et al., 2018); assumption 50yr lifetime chemical factory.

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
